cars.description: Felix loves cars, trucks, and everything on wheels.
cars.title: Cars

climb.description: Felix's cozy corner has gone vertical. He needed a climbing area. It's been an instant hit.
climb.title: Climb

gg1.description: Sunday we walked to Golden Gate Park, which has a giant playground.
gg1.title: Gg 1

gg4.description: Going down is pretty cool too, with a little help from dad.
gg4.title: Gg 4

gg5.description:
Again! Again!

Climbing up and down the play structure was so much fun, Felix asks Dean to take him for a spin again, by using his new baby sign for "again": tapping his palm.
gg5.title: Gg 5

holly_park.description:
Holly Park is sold! The title has changed hands; the money is in the bank. Now we wait a year to see if house prices in San Francisco drop, and maybe buy a bigger place. In the meantime, we have to resist the temptation to quit our jobs and explore the slacker lifestyle with all our laid off friends.

The day before escrow closed, Lucie and Felix went to the house one last time. Felix seemed confused by the place.
holly_park.title: Holly Park

pillow_fight1.description: Dean and Felix like to work off a little energy before bedtime. Tonight, two valiant pillow gladiators step into the arena.
pillow_fight1.title: Pillow Fight 1

pillow_fight3.description: Felix tries to make a getaway, but Dean's got his foot.
pillow_fight3.title: Pillow Fight 3

pillow_fight5.description: Okay Dad, you win; I am ready for bed.
pillow_fight5.title: Pillow Fight 5

description:
Felix really wants to talk. His constant babbling isn't so much babbling as speaking a language that we mostly don't understand. He also gestures furiously; some of it looks like baby signs he has made up, but we're not sure what they mean.

New words:

  • [tap palm]: baby sign for "again" or "more". We have been trying to teach him this very useful sign for a couple of months. He finally got it today, and has put it to a LOT of use already.
  • [flap forearms]: baby sign for "bird". He is still confused about where one species stops and the next one starts. When seeing an extravagant Carnival costume on TV, he flapped his arms and panted at the same time... a bird-dog?
  • chaussette: French for "socks". On Sunday morning, he took a pair of socks from his drawer and said a flawless "chaussettes", twice.
title: April 6
